name: Head Turns
how_to_perform:
1. Start by sitting or standing with good posture and looking forward at a point in front of you.

2. Slowly begin to turn your head to the right, keeping your chin level and your eyes focused on an imaginary point on the wall or ceiling.

3. Hold this position for a breath or two, feeling the stretch in the muscles of your neck.

4. Gradually return your head to its neutral position, looking forward once again.

5. Repeat the movement by turning your head to the left, following the same sequence and time spent stretching on either side.

6. Continue alternating sides for 10-15 repetitions or as directed by a fitness professional.
short_summary: Head turns are a neck-stretching exercise that helps relax and stretch the muscles in the front of the neck.
